title: 103_hr3060
content: The Act may be cited as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" and aims to ensure safe, economical, and effective payroll administration. The "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" amends Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, defining financial organizations and authorizing electronic transfers of employee pay. The Secretary of the Treasury can require employee pay to be made through electronic funds transfer for efficiency and economy, with proper safeguards in place. The Secretary of the Treasury can mandate electronic funds transfer for employee pay, requiring designation of a financial organization recipient and reporting of such designation. The Secretary cannot charge fees to financial organizations or employees for payments made under this section. Financial organizations cannot charge employees for handling payments authorized by the Secretary. The Secretary may exempt employees with annual pay below $20,000 from Electronic Funds Transfer requirements. National security provisions are not affected by this section. The Director of the Central Intelligence Agency can exempt the agency and its employees from certain regulations if compliance would risk disclosing intelligence sources. The Director of the Central Intelligence Agency can exempt the agency and its employees from certain regulations to protect intelligence sources and methods. Financial organizations accepting payments from the United States are fully acquitted, and payments can be made electronically for any purpose authorized by the Secretary. The Secretary can authorize payments in any manner requested, with technical amendments to the relevant code section.
